tables.name: axelar_block_events
tables.description: This table captures block events from various blockchains within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the occurrence of different events across the network. It offers a comprehensive view of the blockchain events and their associated metadata.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the block.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred.

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes associated with the event.

columns.name: source
columns.description: The source of the blockchain data, indicating the specific blockchain from which the event originated.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store the event data.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the event data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: axelar_blocks
tables.description: This table contains information about blocks on Axelar Network, a decentralized platform for cross-chain communication and interoperability within the Cosmos ecosystem. It provides insights into block heights, timestamps, and validator information.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block on the Axelar Network chain

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block was created on Axelar Network

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The identifier of the Axelar Network chain

columns.name: proposer_address
columns.description: The address of the proposer who created the block

columns.name: validators_hash
columns.description: A hash of the validators participating in the block creation process on Axelar Network

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block data was ingested into the database

columns.name: messages_bytes
columns.description: The total size of messages included in the block on Axelar Network

columns.name: tx_count
columns.description: The total number of transactions included in the block on Axelar Network

tables.name: axelar_event_attributes
tables.description: This table contains information about attributes associated with events on the Cosmos ecosystem blockchains. It provides insights into the blockchains' activity, including transaction and event data.

columns.name: deprecated_warning
columns.description: A flag indicating if the data point is deprecated or not.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block where the event occurred.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The ID of the blockchain where the event occurred.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp of the block where the event occurred.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction where the event occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The ID of the transaction where the event occurred.

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: The index of the event within the transaction.

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: The type of event that occurred.

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: The source of the event.

columns.name: attribute_key
columns.description: The key of the attribute associated with the event.

columns.name: attribute_value
columns.description: The value of the attribute associated with the event.

columns.name: attribute_index
columns.description: The index of the attribute within the event.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

tables.name: axelar_message_event_attributes
tables.description: This table provides details on message events in the Axelar network, offering insights into the activities occurring across various chains in the Cosmos ecosystem.

tables.name: axelar_message_events
tables.description: This table contains blockchain data from the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insights into the Axelar network's message events. It captures key information about the block height, transaction details, and event occurrence.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: Height of the block in which the event occurred

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp of the block in which the event occurred

columns.name: tx_hash
columns.description: Unique hash identifying the transaction associated with the event

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: Index of the transaction within the block

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: Index of the message within the transaction

columns.name: event_index
columns.description: Index of the event within the message

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Type of event that occurred

columns.name: event_attributes
columns.description: Additional attributes related to the event

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: Version of the schema used to store the event data

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: Timestamp at which the event data was ingested into the system

tables.name: axelar_transactions
tables.description: Axelar transaction data table, providing information about transactions executed on the Axelar network within the Cosmos ecosystem. This data can be used to analyze transaction behavior, network activity, and associated fees.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The ID of the Cosmos chain on which the transaction was executed.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction.

columns.name: tx_info
columns.description: Additional information about the transaction, including its details and properties.

columns.name: tx_log_message
columns.description: A message associated with the transaction logs.

columns.name: memo
columns.description: A memo or note associated with the transaction.

columns.name: fee
columns.description: The fee associated with the transaction.

columns.name: tx_code
columns.description: The code for the transaction result.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction in the block.

columns.name: gas_used
columns.description: The amount of gas consumed by the transaction.

columns.name: gas_wanted
columns.description: The amount of gas requested for the transaction.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the transaction was ingested into the system.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store the transaction data.

columns.name: fee_coins
columns.description: The coins used to pay the transaction fee.

columns.name: fee_granter
columns.description: The account that granted the permission to pay the transaction fee.

columns.name: fee_payer
columns.description: The account that paid the transaction fee.

columns.name: gas_limit
columns.description: The maximum amount of gas that can be consumed by the transaction.

columns.name: single_sign_mode
columns.description: Whether the transaction was executed in single-sign mode.

columns.name: multi_sign_json
columns.description: The JSON payload associated with multi-sign transactions.

columns.name: timeout_height
columns.description: The height of the block after which the transaction will be considered expired.

tables.name: axelar_tx_messages
tables.description: This table contains transaction messages from various chains within the Cosmos ecosystem, providing insight into the communication and interactions between different blockchain networks.

columns.name: block_height
columns.description: The height of the block in which the transaction was included.

columns.name: chain_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the blockchain where the transaction occurred.

columns.name: tx_id
columns.description: The unique identifier of the transaction that contains the message.

columns.name: tx_index
columns.description: The index of the transaction within the block it was included in.

columns.name: message_index
columns.description: The index of the message within the transaction it belongs to.

columns.name: message_type
columns.description: The type of message being sent, such as a governance proposal or a smart contract execution.

columns.name: message
columns.description: The actual content of the message being sent.

columns.name: ingestion_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the data was ingested into the system.

columns.name: schema_version
columns.description: The version of the schema used to store the transaction message data.

columns.name: block_timestamp
columns.description: The timestamp when the block containing the transaction was created.
